questions.text: The only issue is that your oxygen and stamina will keep on decreasing with time. So, you must carefully choose which task to do first.
optionLabels: Maintaining your own health and energy levels
Fixing the life support system as quickly as possible
Investigating the cause of the damage to prevent future incidents

questions.text: The strange energy signature is getting stronger and more intense. You know something is out there, waiting for you. What is your main concern?
optionLabels: Your physical safety and well-being
Discovering the source of the energy signature
Assessing the potential supplies we have

questions.text: You've suspected for a while now that someone on the crew is up to no good. It's time to confront them and get to the bottom of things. How do you approach the situation?
optionLabels: Discuss your concerns with another crew member before taking action.
Check whether the other crew members are facing breathing issues
Check whether there's a pod to escape

questions.text:
As you sift through the wreckage of the ship, anger and fear course through your veins. Who could have orchestrated such a brutal attack on your crew and your mission? Your mind races as you consider the possibilities, but you must focus on finding the culprit before they strike again.

Who do you suspect is responsible for this heinous act? Is it someone from your own crew, someone you've trusted and worked alongside for months or even years? Or is it an unknown enemy, lurking in the shadows and waiting to strike again?
optionLabels: Your first option is a crew member with a history of insubordination and reckless behavior. Could their past behavior have escalated to the point of sabotage and violence? Or is it simply a coincidence that they have a checkered past?

Your second option is an unknown entity or organization. This option raises even more questions: who are they? Why would they target your mission? And how did they manage to breach your ship's defenses?

questions.text: As you finally have fresh air, you realize that you must act quickly if you want to save yourself and your crew. You need to gather supplies and find the suspect, but where can you find them? Your mind races as you consider your options.
optionLabels: The storage room. It's your best bet for finding the supplies you need to fix the oxygen system, but it's also the most heavily guarded area of the ship. You'll need to watch out for security robots that could attack at any moment

The security camera footage. This critical piece of evidence will require you to search the ship and locate the security camera system. Will you be able to navigate the twists and turns of the ship to find the footage you need?

questions.text: As you gasp for air in the rapidly depleting oxygen of your spaceship, you realize that the fate of your crew and the success of your mission depend on your ability to uncover the truth. But where do you begin?
optionLabels: The medical bay. You might be able to find some basic medical supplies to help you on your mission

The communication logs. This key piece of data could hold the key to understanding what really happened. But to access it, you'll need to locate and hack into the communication system. Will you be able to overcome the challenges and obstacles in your path to uncover the truth?

questions.text: Your heart races as you consider the risks and rewards of each option. What do you feel is the most immediate threat?
optionLabels: It's a straight shot to the supplies, but I'll need to move fast if you want to get there before the oxygen runs out.
The oxygen supply chamber is very far away but someone has to fix the pressure.
I'm very afraid of an intruder. Maybe an alien!!

questions.text: The clock is ticking and every second counts. It seems I'm already out of breath. The fate of the mission rests on your shoulders as you search for the critical data that will help you uncover the truth behind the attack on your spaceship. How do you save your crew and complete your mission?
optionLabels: Go to the control room to get the keys for the supply room.
Go to the medical station to get temporary oxygen to extend your life.
Go to the engineering bay. You must navigate through the twists and turns of the bay to uncover the data you need.

questions.text: I have just accused someone and I don't feel good. The clock is ticking and every second counts. Where will you find the supplies you need to confront them?
optionLabels: The armory, a heavily guarded room filled with powerful weapons and ammunition. The path to the armory is treacherous, and the player must use their wits to navigate past security measures and guards.

The cafeteria, where the player can stock up on food and water to sustain them during the fight. The cafeteria is a dangerous place, and the player must be on the lookout for any traps or ambushes set by the suspect.

questions.text: The crew members are very thirsty and everybody needs water. But the cafeteria is fully empty. I wonder if it's the same guy?
optionLabels: Go to the captain's chambers to fetch the emergency water supply.
Check the CCTV footage of the cafeteria.

questions.text: I have just accused someone and I don't feel good. There's very little oxygen left in the tank. I have to do something quickly.
optionLabels: Go to the medical station to get temporary oxygen to extend your life.
The data is encrypted and requires a password. You'll need to use your wits to solve a complex puzzle and crack the code before you can access the valuable data.

questions.text: As you struggles to push through the fear and uncertainty of the situation, you desperately search for something to hold onto. Suddenly, a memory comes to mind - a moment of happiness that fills you with strength and hope. Where do you turn to in your mind for this memory?
optionLabels: A memory of a successful mission with her crew, where they worked together seamlessly and accomplished their goal, reminding her of the strength and resilience of her team.
Protect the crew members at all costs even if it means confronting one of the crew members.
